greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n into distinct parts, where k is the difference between the number of odd parts and the number of even parts; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for all n >= 0, k in A001057.  Row n contains all terms from the leftmost to the rightmost nonzero term.  All other terms (not in the triangle) are equal to 0. First nonzero term of column k>=0 is at n = k^2, first nonzero term of column k<=0 is at n = k*(k+1).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..500, flattened
formula: G.f.: prod(n>=1, 1 + e(n)*q^n ) = 1 + sum(n>=1, e(n)*q^n * prod(k=1..n-1, 1+e(k)*q^k) ) where e(n) = u if n odd, otherwise 1/u; see Pari program. [_Joerg Arndt_, Apr 01 2014]
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=ldegree(p)..degree(p)))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n>i*(i+1)/2, 0, If[n == 0, 1, Expand[b[n, i-1] + If[i>n, 0, b[n-i, i-1]*x^(2*Mod[i, 2]-1)]]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[ Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, Exponent[p, x, Min], Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n]]; Table[ T[n], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 11 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: { for (j=1, #V,  \\ print triangle, including leading zeros
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 31 2014
